Left Question: Some people go along with their friends just to keep their friends happy
Right Question: Other people refuse to go along with their friends even though they know it will make their friends happy

Left Question: Some people think it's more important to be an individual than to fit in with the crowd
Right Question: Other people think its more important to fit in with the crowd than to stand out as an individual

Left Question: For some people it's pretty easy for their friends to get them to change their mind
Right Question: For other people it's pretty hard for their friends to get them to change their mind

Left Question: Some people hide their true opinion from their friends if they think their friends will hassle them
Right Question: Other people will say their true opinion in front of their friends even if they know their friends will hassle them

Left Question: Some people will do something they think is wrong just to stay on their friend's' good side
Right Question: Other people will not do something they think is wrong even if it will make their friends mad at them

Left Question: Some people act just as risky when they are alone as when they are with their friends
Right Question: Other people take more risks when they are with their friends then they do when they are alone

Left Question: Some people say things they don't really believe because they think it will make their friends respect them more
Right Question: Other people will say things they don't really believe just to get their friends to respect them more

Left Question: Some people change the way they act so much when they are with their friends that they sometimes wonder who they "really are"
Right Question: Other people act the same way when they are lone as they do when they are with their friends
